channel.title: Ripping DVDs and converting (Begginer)
channel.description:
Originally written for http://warezws.com But now I decided to post it on moparisthebest.com
Hello, This is my tutorial (Written purely by me) about how to rip and convert DVDs. There will be two ways involved in doing this. One is longer and one is shorter (To put it simply). I will provide download links for all programs used and put it in the simplest language possible. I hope you learn something. The second Method was not written by me it was just copied out from memory. [size=10pt][u][b]Method 1:[/b][/u][/size] Very basic way of ripping and converting use DVD Decrypter to rip the main .VOB movie file to your HDD and then use a converter to convert it to your preffered format. [size=10pt][u][b]Tools Involved:[/b][/u][/size] [b] [ul]DVD Decrypter[/ul]
Download: [code]http://rapidshare.com/files/40563934/DVD_WarezWS.com_uploaded_by_haxed.rar[/code] [b] [ul]WinAVIvideo Converter[/ul]
Download: [code]http://rapidshare.com/files/34050420/cvw_8_0_uploaded_by_MustafaBakar.rar[/code] [size=10pt] [i][u][b]Step 1:[/b][/u][/i][/size] First insert the DVD you want to rip and convert into your DVD drive and open DVD Decrypter when it is inserted: [img]http://i9.tinypic.com/68c376c.jpg[/img] Then select [i]Edit > Select main movie PGC[/i] [img]http://i14.tinypic.com/4vq128o.jpg[/img] Then click the Stream Processing tab. And [i]Enable Stream Processing [/i] [img]http://i10.tinypic.com/52qc0vk.jpg[/img] Then finally click the Decrypt button [img]http://i10.tinypic.com/4mwdhjn.jpg[/img] For me it usually takes 4-6hours to decrypt a DVD but this will vary because of DVD drive reading speed (How fast it can read the disc). When it is done find where it ripped to (Usually a folder on C: Drive). And find the main VOB (Will be between 4-9GB).
[size=10pt][u][i][b]Step 2:[/b][/i][/u][/size] [b]WinAVIVideo Converter[/b] open it up: [img]http://i15.tinypic.com/53gin29.jpg[/img] Click the big button that has AVI on it. Or whatever you want it to be converted to. [img]http://i18.tinypic.com/534u23l.jpg[/img] Then locate the .VOB file you want to convert: [img]http://i17.tinypic.com/507oi29.jpg[/img] Then it will come up with this screen, Browse where you want the output to go and press advanced if you want to change the height and width of the screen and other things: [img]http://i10.tinypic.com/6cyubm8.jpg[/img] [img]http://i11.tinypic.com/4xo9cut.jpg[/img] Then you're done and you now have a .avi file of the movie (Or whatever you converted it to). And you may now delete the large .VOB file if you want. (They take up a lot of room believe me I have 90GB of them). Remember you may use any converter you want that converts .VOB files. [size=10pt][b][u]Method 2:[/u][/b][/size] This method is more tedious and complicated then the previous method. I don't personally use it. I am just writing this in memory of another tutorial I read like this. Re-writing this in the pursuit of knowledge basically. [size=18][u] [b]Tools Involved:[/b][/u][/size] -DVD2AVI -CladDVD -CladBRC -VirtualDub All are included in the below file: Download: [code]http://rapidshare.com/files/40690996/DVD_RIPPINGTOOLS_uploaded_by_haxed_warezws.com.rar[/code] [size=10pt][i][b][u]Step 1: Installing[/i][/b][/u][/size] Install: -CladDVD -CladBRC -VirtualDUB but not DVD2AVI because it's an executable no need to install. Remember you need the Xvid or DivX codec. (You must probably have it if you can play .avi files) [i][b][u][size=18]Step 2: Ripping the DVD[/i][/b][/u][/size] Remember you may want to use DVD Decrypter instead :) Open up CladDVD: [img]http://i13.tinypic.com/6bw5oiw.jpg[/img] Choose the tab: “PGC Mode [AVI]”. Normally CladDVD will select the files for you. The file you are looking for is usually the longest (time) one. Click on "Options" on the right and choose your destination folder. Then Click start rip and the ripping will begin.
[size=10pt][i][b][u]Step 3:Calculating the bit rate[/i][/b][/u][/size] [img]http://i8.tinypic.com/61nnqtl.jpg[/img] Find out the length of your movie (Own knowledge, back of DVD cover or you can use http://IMDB.com/). Insert the number of minutes into the textbox and click go.
Now you can choose which configuration you want. The 1 and 2 stands for the number of files you will have. 1 Means 1 avi file, 2 means 2 avi files. Choose for yourself what’s best. Off course, when you choose 700Mb, the quality of the file(s) will be better…
[size=10pt][i][b][u]Step 4:From VOB to .AVI[/i][/b][/u][/size] Open DVD2AVI: [img]http://i16.tinypic.com/4r099ib.jpg[/img] Click File > Open, Then select one VOB file. DVD2AVI will automatically select the other VOB files needed unless there is only one. [img]http://i15.tinypic.com/68kxm5w.jpg[/img] Note: If you move the slidebar a little you will see the movie. [img]http://i14.tinypic.com/62n5gs1.jpg[/img] If you notice black borders on the top or bottom or on the sides. You may want to get rid of them. If you do follow these steps: Click on video > Clip & resize [img]http://i13.tinypic.com/66emvxg.jpg[/img] [img]http://i8.tinypic.com/63s245i.jpg[/img]
Choose the video aspect you want. Set the filter type to: “precise bicubic” Close the window
Now save the AVI file go to file > Save AVI [img]http://i16.tinypic.com/66txg1k.jpg[/img] and type in a filename
After you have done that a pop-up window will appear, asking for compression methods. Choose DivX or XviD for the compressor (Or whatever you want)Then click Configure. [img]http://img165.imageshack.us/img165/7827/step92tz7.jpg[/img] [img]http://img244.imageshack.us/img244/2825/step102gb2.jpg[/img] (This ^^ screen may vary depending on your codec). Now change the bit-rate box to what you calculated earlier and any other things you may want to change. Press OK Then press OK again This process can take a while 1-3hours+
[size=10pt][i][b][u]Step 5:Combining the AVI and WAV[/i][/b][/u][/size] Open VirtualDUB. As you may have realized DVD2AVI has created two files. The video file and the sound file. You must combine these two. Click file > Open Video File (choose the file you just made) [img]http://img525.imageshack.us/img525/6301/step122if9kk4.jpg[/img] After that click Video > Direct Stream Copy [img]http://img150.imageshack.us/img150/7774/step132ba9.jpg[/img] After that, click Audio > WAV Audio [img]http://img46.imageshack.us/img46/3937/step142ua8.jpg[/img] And find the WAV audio DVD2AVI just created [img]http://img49.imageshack.us/img49/7537/step152hq8.jpg[/img] Now go to Audio again and click "Full processing Mode" (Because you have to change some things) [img]http://img49.imageshack.us/img49/6166/step162hd2.jpg[/img] Now click Audio > Interleaving [img]http://img512.imageshack.us/img512/756/step172ke2.jpg[/img] Now change "Interleave Audio every 1 frames" into "Interleave Audio every 500 ms" [img]http://img512.imageshack.us/img512/63/step182bm1.jpg[/img] Now go to Audio > Compression [img]http://img162.imageshack.us/img162/2793/step192ob7.jpg[/img] And Select: Mpeg Layer-3; 128kbits/s 48kHz Stereo 16kB/s. Press “OK”. Note: Keep the kHz at 48 but you can change 160kbit/s instead of 128kbit/s but remember this will make your file larger. [img]http://img211.imageshack.us/img211/7901/step202vp0.jpg[/img] Now go to Audio > Volume, Set it to 200% [img]http://img172.imageshack.us/img172/9334/step212tt3.jpg[/img] Now go to File > Save AVI [img]http://img514.imageshack.us/img514/4673/step222qf2.jpg[/img] After this just type the file name in and you're done. Any Questions? Just post.

item.title: Ripping DVDs and converting (Begginer)
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Hmm, nice find, but this tutorial is old.

DVD Decrypter can’t break the new encryption methods since development stopped when they were sued by the MPAA or some big movie organization.

DVDFab Decrypter is the new developed one. If you can incorporate that into your tutorial, that would be great.
http://www.dvdfab.com/free.htm

~Ron

Read full topic

item.title: Ripping DVDs and converting (Begginer)
item.dc:creator: @haxed haxed
item.description:
@haxed wrote:

Originally written for http://warezws.com
But now I decided to post it on moparisthebest.com

Hello, This is my tutorial (Written purely by me) about how to rip and convert DVDs. There will be two ways involved in doing this. One is longer and one is shorter (To put it simply). I will provide download links for all programs used and put it in the simplest language possible. I hope you learn something. The second Method was not written by me it was just copied out from memory.
[size=10pt]Method 1:[/size]
Very basic way of ripping and converting use DVD Decrypter to rip the main .VOB movie file to your HDD and then use a converter to convert it to your preffered format.
[size=10pt]Tools Involved:[/size]
[b]
[ul]DVD Decrypter[/ul]

Download:

http://rapidshare.com/files/40563934/DVD_WarezWS.com_uploaded_by_haxed.rar

[b]
[ul]WinAVIvideo Converter[/ul]

Download:

http://rapidshare.com/files/34050420/cvw_8_0_uploaded_by_MustafaBakar.rar

[size=10pt]
Step 1:[/size]
First insert the DVD you want to rip and convert into your DVD drive and open DVD Decrypter when it is inserted:

Then select
Edit > Select main movie PGC

Then click the Stream Processing tab. And Enable Stream Processing

Then finally click the Decrypt button

For me it usually takes 4-6hours to decrypt a DVD but this will vary because of DVD drive reading speed (How fast it can read the disc).
When it is done find where it ripped to (Usually a folder on C: Drive). And find the main VOB (Will be between 4-9GB).

[size=10pt]Step 2:[/size]
WinAVIVideo Converter open it up:

Click the big button that has AVI on it. Or whatever you want it to be converted to.

Then locate the .VOB file you want to convert:

507oi29.jpg829×523

Then it will come up with this screen, Browse where you want the output to go and press advanced if you want to change the height and width of the screen and other things:

4xo9cut.jpg888×558

Then you’re done and you now have a .avi file of the movie (Or whatever you converted it to). And you may now delete the large .VOB file if you want. (They take up a lot of room believe me I have 90GB of them).
Remember you may use any converter you want that converts .VOB files.
[size=10pt]Method 2:[/size]
This method is more tedious and complicated then the previous method. I don’t personally use it. I am just writing this in memory of another tutorial I read like this. Re-writing this in the pursuit of knowledge basically.
[size=18]
Tools Involved:[/size]
-DVD2AVI
-CladDVD
-CladBRC
-VirtualDub
All are included in the below file:
Download:

http://rapidshare.com/files/40690996/DVD_RIPPINGTOOLS_uploaded_by_haxed_warezws.com.rar

[size=10pt][b][u]Step 1: Installing[/b][/u][/size]
Install:
-CladDVD
-CladBRC
-VirtualDUB
but not DVD2AVI because it’s an executable no need to install. Remember you need the Xvid or DivX codec. (You must probably have it if you can play .avi files)
[b][u][size=18]Step 2: Ripping the DVD[/b][/u][/size]
Remember you may want to use DVD Decrypter instead
Open up CladDVD:

Choose the tab: “PGC Mode [AVI]”. Normally CladDVD will select the files for you. The file you are looking for is usually the longest (time) one. Click on “Options” on the right and choose your destination folder. Then Click start rip and the ripping will begin.

[size=10pt][b][u]Step 3:Calculating the bit rate[/b][/u][/size]

Find out the length of your movie (Own knowledge, back of DVD cover or you can use http://IMDB.com/). Insert the number of minutes into the textbox and click go.

Now you can choose which configuration you want. The 1 and 2 stands for the number of files you will have. 1 Means 1 avi file, 2 means 2 avi files. Choose for yourself what’s best. Off course, when you choose 700Mb, the quality of the file(s) will be better…

[size=10pt][b][u]Step 4:From VOB to .AVI[/b][/u][/size]
Open DVD2AVI:

Click File > Open, Then select one VOB file. DVD2AVI will automatically select the other VOB files needed unless there is only one.

Note: If you move the slidebar a little you will see the movie.

If you notice black borders on the top or bottom or on the sides. You may want to get rid of them. If you do follow these steps:
Click on video > Clip & resize

66emvxg.jpg725×514

63s245i.jpg727×517

Choose the video aspect you want.
Set the filter type to: “precise bicubic”
Close the window

Now save the AVI file go to file > Save AVI

66txg1k.jpg727×517

and type in a filename

After you have done that a pop-up window will appear, asking for compression methods. Choose DivX or XviD for the compressor (Or whatever you want)Then click Configure.


(This ^^ screen may vary depending on your codec). Now change the bit-rate box to what you calculated earlier and any other things you may want to change.
Press OK
Then press OK again
This process can take a while 1-3hours+

[size=10pt][b][u]Step 5:Combining the AVI and WAV[/b][/u][/size]
Open VirtualDUB.
As you may have realized DVD2AVI has created two files. The video file and the sound file. You must combine these two.
Click file > Open Video File (choose the file you just made)

After that click Video > Direct Stream Copy

After that, click Audio > WAV Audio

And find the WAV audio DVD2AVI just created

Now go to Audio again and click “Full processing Mode” (Because you have to change some things)

Now click Audio > Interleaving

Now change “Interleave Audio every 1 frames” into “Interleave Audio every 500 ms”

Now go to Audio > Compression

And Select: Mpeg Layer-3; 128kbits/s 48kHz Stereo 16kB/s. Press “OK”.
Note: Keep the kHz at 48 but you can change 160kbit/s instead of 128kbit/s but remember this will make your file larger.

Now go to Audio > Volume, Set it to 200%

Now go to File > Save AVI

After this just type the file name in and you’re done. Any Questions? Just post.

Read full topic
